New Records: Joel Embiid finished with 13 points, 3 rebounds, 5 assists, 1 block, and 2 turnovers in his season debut.
Paul George scored a game-high 29 points, his best as a Sixer, making 7 of 11 three-pointers.
Key Match Events: The New York Knicks went on a 13-0 run to take an 89-75 lead with 8:14 to play, which turned out to be the difference.
Joel Embiid had a momentary scare after colliding with Karl-Anthony Towns, leading to a short bench exit.
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Nick Nurse noted Embiid's rust and conditioning issues, though he showed competitive spirit.
Joel Embiid expressed his role in setting up plays and the team's need to maintain rhythm.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the NBA Cup opener for the Sixers, with the Knicks improving to 5-5 and 1-0 in the standings.
Rookie Jared McCain scored 23 points, making four three-pointers, and had a solid performance.
